entries.meaning: (authorship) A dramatic device in which a future event is inserted into the normal chronological flow of a narrative.
examples: This "Lone Ranger" begins and ends in a flash-forward, with an elderly Tonto installed in a carnival diorama behind a sign that reads "The Noble Savage."

verbs.description: flashforward (third-person singular simple present flashforwards, present participle flashforwarding, simple past and past participle flashforwarded)
